sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"产品，制品"之意。
means: manufacture ： 一般指机器大量制造的产品。
produce ： 多指农产品(尤指蔬菜水果等)。
product ： 一般指工业产品，也可泛指各种各样的产品。
production ： 含义广泛，不同场合有不同的意思，可表示"产品，产物"，尤指人类智力或艺术劳动的产品。

induce[v.引诱,劝使;引起,导致;感应]+ment具体物→n.引诱物
pro向前+duce引导,带来→引向前→生产
produce的名词化→生产出的东西
de向下+duce引导,带来→向下引→推论

tra横+duce引导,带来→向横引→不正→诽谤

entry.def: A product is something that is produced and sold in large quantities, often as a result of a manufacturing process.

example.ex: Try to get the best product at the lowest price...
example.tran: 尽量以最低的价格买到最好的产品。

example.ex: South Korea's imports of consumer products jumped 33% in this year.
example.tran: 今年，韩国消费产品的进口激增了33%。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is a product of a situation or process, you mean that the situation or process has had a significant effect in making them what they are.

example.ex: We are all products of our time...
example.tran: 我们都是这个时代的产物。

example.ex: The bank is the product of a 1971 merger of two Japanese banks.
example.tran: 这家银行是由两家日本银行于1971年合并而成。

sentences.sentence: "good business depends on having good merchandise"
"that store offers a variety of products"

means.word_mean: 2. an artifact that has been created by someone or some process;

sentences.sentence: "they export most of their agricultural production"

means.word_mean: 3. a consequence of someone's efforts or of a particular set of circumstances;

sentences.sentence: "skill is the product of hours of practice"
"his reaction was the product of hunger and fatigue"

means.word_mean: 4. a chemical substance formed as a result of a chemical reaction;

sentences.sentence: "a product of lime and nitric acid"

means.word_mean: 6. the set of elements common to two or more sets;

sentences.sentence: "the set of red hats is the intersection of the set of hats and the set of red things"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a mathematical term): from Latin productum 'something produced', neuter past participle (used as a noun) of producere 'bring forth' (see produce)

sentences.cn: 发明者正想推销他的新产品.
sentences.en: The inventor is trying to market his new product.

sentences.cn: 产品经理对产品的盈利状况负责.
sentences.en: A product manager is responsible for product profitability.

sentences.cn: 这些青年工人为提高产品质量,提出了顶呱呱的新建议.
sentences.en: The young workers brought forth some sparkling new suggestions for improving our product.

sentences.cn: 本保证书自购置此产品之日起有效期为一年.
sentences.en: This warranty is good for one year after the date of the purchase of the product.

sentences.cn: 战后产品市场的地理范围扩大了.
sentences.en: The geographical scope of product markets has widened since the war.

sentences.cn: 我们需要新产品供销售。
sentences.en: (business 商)We need new product to sell (= a new range of products) .

sentences.en: investment in product development

sentences.cn: 把新产品推向市场
sentences.en: to launch a new product on to the market

sentences.cn: 尽量以最低的价格买到最好的产品。
sentences.en: Try to get the best product at the lowest price...

sentences.cn: 今年，韩国消费产品的进口激增了33%。
sentences.en: South Korea's imports of consumer products jumped 33% in this year.

sentences.cn: 推销产品的市场营销人员掌控着付费和自有媒体。
sentences.en: Paid and owned media are controlled by marketers promoting their own products.

sentences.cn: 如果上述情况发生，情绪激动地消费者会努力劝说其他人共同抵制某公司的产品，从而危及到企业的声誉。
sentences.en: If that happens, passionate consumers would try to persuade others to boycott products, putting the reputation of the target company at risk.

sentences.cn: “我会提价，并使之成为一种更类似于文化遗产的产品”。【句子解析】本句是一个简单句，其主语是I，and连接并列的谓语would raise和(would ) make ；名词prices作would raise的宾语；代词it“作（would) make的宾语,介词短语into more of a legacy product作宾语it的补足语.注意本句是一个直接引语，作⑥句中said的宾语。
sentences.en: “I would raise prices and make it into more of a legacy product.”

sentences.cn: “生成积极习惯是改善消费者生活的重要部分，它也对使新产品具有商业可行性至关重要。”
sentences.en: “Creating positive habits is a huge part of improving our consumers' lives, and it's essential to making new products commercially viable.”

sentences.cn: 变化总是存在的，新工作、新产品和新服务都会出现。
sentences.en: There will always be change—new jobs, new products, new services.

sentences.cn: 一份哈佛大学公共卫生学院的研究报告表明，许多像杀虫剂和清洁剂一样的日用产品会提高儿童大脑和行为障碍产生的风险。
sentences.en: According to a report from the Harvard School of Public Health, many everyday products, including some bug sprays and cleaning  fluids , could lead to an increased risk of brain and behavioral disorders in children.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 报告称：发育中的大脑对于这些产品中所含化学物质的毒性的抵抗力尤为(26) 弱，而这些物质造成的危害可能是 (27) 永久性的。
sentences.en: The developing brain, the report says, is particularly 26 vulnerable to the  toxic effects of certain  chemicals these products may contain, and the damage they cause can be 27 permanent.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 根据美国联邦贸易委员会提出的修改意见，那些声称生产环境友好型产品的制造商在向消费者宣传自己时将面临更严格的规定。
sentences.en: Manufacturers of products that claim to be environmentally friendly will face tighter rules on how they are advertised to consumers under changes proposed by the Federal Trade Commission.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 销售商必须在产品包装上具体解释其声明，并将声明限定在某个具体益处上，如说明该产品中有多少成分是被循环利用的。
sentences.en: Marketers must qualify their claims on the product packaging and limit them to a specific benefit, such as how much of the product is recycled.

sentences.en: Plain  packaging  would  be  another  step  in  the reclassification  of  cigarettes  from  inviting  consumer  products  to narcotics ( 麻醉剂 )

sentences.cn: 在其他实验中，Lupyan 和Swignley 发现，搜寻常见产品时 (31) 说出其名字有助于让人找得更快，但是对于罕见产品，念念叨叨并没有显现出好处，还会让你慢下来。
sentences.en: In other experiments, Lupyan and Swignley found that 31 uttering the name of a common product when on the hunt for it helped quicken someone’s pace, but talking about uncommon items showed no advantage and slowed you down.
